articles.headline: Microsoft C.E.O. Testifies That Google’s Power in Search Is Ubiquitous
articles.snippet: Satya Nadella, the chief executive of Microsoft, is the government’s biggest-name witness in its landmark antitrust case against Google.
articles.abstract: Satya Nadella, the chief executive of Microsoft, is the government’s biggest-name witness in its landmark antitrust case against Google.
articles.lead_paragraph: Satya Nadella, Microsoft’s chief executive, testified on Monday that Google’s power in online search was so ubiquitous that even his company found it difficult to compete on the internet, becoming the government’s highest-profile witness in its landmark antitrust trial against the search giant.
articles.byline: By David McCabe and Cecilia Kang

articles.headline: What to Know About Laphonza Butler, Newsom’s Appointee to the Senate
articles.snippet: Ms. Butler, 44, was chosen on Sunday to fill the vacancy created by the death of Senator Dianne Feinstein.
articles.abstract: Ms. Butler, 44, was chosen on Sunday to fill the vacancy created by the death of Senator Dianne Feinstein.
articles.lead_paragraph: Laphonza Butler, president of Emily’s List and a former labor leader, is Gov. Gavin Newsom of California’s choice to fill the Senate seat of Dianne Feinstein, who died at 90 on Thursday in Washington, D.C. The selection was announced on Sunday.

articles.headline: China Is Suffering a Brain Drain. The U.S. Isn’t Exploiting It.
articles.snippet: China’s brightest minds, including tech professionals, are emigrating, but many are not heading to America. We spoke to them to ask why.
articles.abstract: China’s brightest minds, including tech professionals, are emigrating, but many are not heading to America. We spoke to them to ask why.
articles.lead_paragraph: They went to the best universities in China and in the West. They lived middle-class lives in Beijing, Shanghai and Shenzhen and worked for technology companies at the center of China’s tech rivalry with the United States.

articles.headline: With Surge in Attacks, Militants Begin New Era of Bloodshed in Pakistan
articles.snippet: For nearly a decade, the country had seemingly broken the cycle of violence, but extremist groups have bounced back since the Taliban regained control in neighboring Afghanistan.
articles.abstract: For nearly a decade, the country had seemingly broken the cycle of violence, but extremist groups have bounced back since the Taliban regained control in neighboring Afghanistan.
articles.lead_paragraph: It was a bloody reminder that the dark days of extremist violence appeared to have returned to Pakistan: a suicide attack on a religious festival in the country’s southwest this past week that left around 60 people dead.
articles.byline: By Christina Goldbaum and Zia ur-Rehman

articles.headline: Trump Wanted to Fire Missiles at Mexico. Now the G.O.P. Wants to Send Troops.
articles.snippet: The Republican push to use military force in Mexico against drug cartels started in the Trump White House. He has plans to make the idea a reality in 2025.
articles.abstract: The Republican push to use military force in Mexico against drug cartels started in the Trump White House. He has plans to make the idea a reality in 2025.
articles.lead_paragraph: The first time Donald Trump talked privately about shooting missiles into Mexico to take out drug labs, as far as his former aides can recall, was in early 2020.
articles.byline: By Jonathan Swan, Maggie Haberman, Charlie Savage and Emiliano Rodríguez Mega

articles.headline: A Rural Michigan Town Is the Latest Battleground in the U.S.-China Fight
articles.snippet: Firestorms over Chinese investments, like a battery factory in Green Charter Township, are erupting as officials weigh the risks of taking money from an adversary.
articles.abstract: Firestorms over Chinese investments, like a battery factory in Green Charter Township, are erupting as officials weigh the risks of taking money from an adversary.
articles.lead_paragraph: Yard signs along the quiet country roads of Green Charter Township, Mich., home to horse farms and a 19th-century fish hatchery, blare a message that an angered community hopes is heard by local leaders, the Biden administration and China: “No Gotion.”

articles.headline: McCarthy Is Ousted as Speaker, Leaving the House in Chaos
articles.snippet: A handful of far-right Republicans broke with their party and voted to remove Kevin McCarthy from his leadership post. He said he would not run again.
articles.abstract: A handful of far-right Republicans broke with their party and voted to remove Kevin McCarthy from his leadership post. He said he would not run again.
articles.lead_paragraph: The House voted on Tuesday to oust Representative Kevin McCarthy from the speakership, a move without precedent that left the chamber without a leader and plunged it into chaos.

articles.headline: ‘Elemental’ Morphs From Flop to Hit, Raising Questions Along the Way
articles.snippet: The Pixar film struggled at the box office initially. It has now made $500 million, but not before prompting the studio to re-examine its release strategy.
articles.abstract: The Pixar film struggled at the box office initially. It has now made $500 million, but not before prompting the studio to re-examine its release strategy.
